task.summary:
Add initial implementation of Split Bill application with Flask
- Create main application file (app.py) for managing expenses - Implement data models for persons, items, and shared costs (models.py) - Add calculation logic for expense distribution (calculator.py) - Develop HTML interface for user interaction (index.html) - Include CSS for styling (style.css) - Set up instructions and quickstart guide (INSTRUCCIONES.txt, QUICKSTART.md) - Add .gitignore for environment files and IDE settings - Implement basic test script for functionality verification (test.py)

Update item management to include quantity and unit price
- Modified Item model to add quantity and unit_price fields, and total_cost property for automatic calculation. - Updated add_item route to accept quantity and unit price, with validation for positive values. - Adjusted calculation logic to use total_cost instead of cost for expense distribution. - Enhanced HTML form to include fields for quantity and unit price, and updated item display table accordingly. - Revised tests to reflect new item structure and ensure correct calculations. - Updated documentation to reflect these changes and provide usage examples.

Add URL field to items for product links
- Introduced an optional URL field in the item model to store product links. - Updated the item addition route to accept and process the URL. - Enhanced the HTML form to include a URL input and modified the item display table to show a clickable link. - Adjusted styles for the new URL input and link button. - Updated tests to cover scenarios with and without URLs.

Implement multi-trip support in Split Bill application
- Added functionality to create and manage multiple trips, each with its own participants, items, and shared costs. - Updated routes to handle trip-specific actions, including adding and removing trips, and managing items and persons within a trip. - Introduced new templates for trip listing and trip details, enhancing user navigation and experience. - Refactored data models to accommodate trip data organization.

Implement multi-day support in Split Bill application
- Added functionality to specify the number of days for each trip. - Updated models to include a days field for trips, items, and shared costs. - Enhanced item and shared cost management to associate them with specific days. - Modified the user interface to allow input of days and display daily summaries. - Implemented calculations for totals by day and overall trip summary. - Introduced a verification panel to ensure total expenses match distributed amounts.
Refactor item toggle response and remove toast notifications
